channel.title: Parsing API Data :: K-State CIS 400 Textbook
channel.description: Web APIs typically provide their data in a structured format, i.e. XML or JSON. To use this within a C# program youâ€™ll need to either parse it or convert it into an object or objects. The Joke of the Day API can provide either - we just need to specify our preference with a Accept header in our HTTP request. This header lets the server know what format(s) of data we are ready to process.
